title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 31 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 31.

questions.question: How old was Moses when he spoke to all Israel according to Deuteronomy 31?
questions.correctAnswer: 120 years old
questions.explanation: Moses declared he was one hundred and twenty years old this day (Deuteronomy 31:2).

questions.question: Who was appointed to lead Israel into the land promised by God?
questions.correctAnswer: Joshua
questions.explanation: God said Joshua will go over before the people as the LORD hath said (Deuteronomy 31:3).

questions.question: What did Moses command the Levites to do with the book of the law?
options: Put it in the side of the ark of the covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Put it in the side of the ark of the covenant
questions.explanation: Moses instructed the Levites to place the book of the law in the side of the ark of the covenant (Deuteronomy 31:26).

questions.question: What encouragement did Moses give to Joshua before leading Israel?
options: Be strong and of a good courage
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and of a good courage
questions.explanation: Moses told Joshua to be strong and courageous because he must lead the people (Deuteronomy 31:7).

questions.question: What will happen at the end of every seven years according to Moses' command?
options: The law shall be read before all Israel
A new king shall be appointed
questions.correctAnswer: The law shall be read before all Israel
questions.explanation: Moses commanded that at the end of every seven years the law should be read in the presence of all Israel (Deuteronomy 31:10-11).

questions.question: Who were to gather and hear the reading of the law at the feast of tabernacles?
options: Men, women, children, and strangers within the gates
questions.correctAnswer: Men, women, children, and strangers within the gates
questions.explanation: All men, women, children, and strangers within the gates were to be gathered to hear the law (Deuteronomy 31:12).

questions.question: Where did Moses and Joshua present themselves to receive a charge from the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle of the congregation
questions.explanation: Moses and Joshua presented themselves in the tabernacle of the congregation as commanded by the LORD (Deuteronomy 31:14).

questions.question: How did the LORD appear in the tabernacle when giving a charge to Joshua?
options: In a pillar of a cloud
questions.correctAnswer: In a pillar of a cloud
questions.explanation: The LORD appeared in a pillar of a cloud over the door of the tabernacle (Deuteronomy 31:15).

questions.question: What did the LORD say would happen after Moses died?
options: The people would forsake God and break His covenant
The people would enter the promised land peacefully
The people would build a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: The people would forsake God and break His covenant
questions.explanation: God foretold that after Moses' death the people would turn to other gods and break His covenant (Deuteronomy 31:16).

questions.question: What was Moses instructed to write as a witness against Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: A song
questions.explanation: Moses was told to write a song to be a witness against the children of Israel (Deuteronomy 31:19).

questions.question: True or False: The LORD promised He would forsake Joshua when he leads Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The LORD promised He will be with Joshua, will not fail nor forsake him (Deuteronomy 31:8).

questions.question: True or False: Moses wrote the words of the law in a book until they were finished.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Moses finished writing the words of the law in a book (Deuteronomy 31:24).

questions.question: True or False: Moses was confident the people would remain obedient after his death.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Moses knew the people would rebel and corrupt themselves after his death (Deuteronomy 31:29).

questions.question: Complete this verse from Deuteronomy 31:6: 'Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the LORD thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor ______ thee.'
questions.correctAnswer: forsake
questions.explanation: The verse specifies the LORD will not fail nor forsake you (Deuteronomy 31:6).

questions.question: Complete this verse from Deuteronomy 31:13: 'And that their children, which have not known any thing, may hear, and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as ye live in the land whither ye go over ______ to possess it.'
questions.correctAnswer: Jordan
questions.explanation: The children are to learn to fear the LORD as long as they live in the land over Jordan (Deuteronomy 31:13).

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 31 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Deuteronomy 31, what biblical truth would you share about facing difficulties?
options: Be strong and courageous because the LORD will not fail or forsake you
Avoid all challenges by staying isolated from others
Rely solely on your own strength without trusting God
Ignore God's promises and focus on worldly solutions
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and courageous because the LORD will not fail or forsake you
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:6-8 encourages believers to be strong and courageous, reassuring that God goes before them and will not fail or forsake them, teaching trust and perseverance in trials.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 31 teach us about the importance of spiritual leadership in guiding a community of faith?
options: Leaders must be strong and courageous and lead God’s people into His promises
Leaders should avoid responsibility and delegate all decisions
Spiritual leadership is optional and not necessary for faithfulness
Leaders should focus only on worldly success and not spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders must be strong and courageous and lead God’s people into His promises
questions.explanation: Moses charges Joshua to be strong and courageous to lead Israel into the promised land (Deuteronomy 31:7, 31:23), showing the vital role of spiritual leadership.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 31, how should a believer respond to fear or discouragement?
options: Fear not, because the LORD goes with you and will not forsake you
Give in to fear and avoid all challenges
Rely on others instead of God for courage
Ignore God’s presence and face difficulties alone
questions.correctAnswer: Fear not, because the LORD goes with you and will not forsake you
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:6 and 31:8 emphasize that believers should not fear or be dismayed because God will be with them and will not fail them.

questions.question: What practical advice does Deuteronomy 31 give about teaching the next generation in faith?
options: Gather all people, including children and strangers, to hear and learn the law
Teach only adults and exclude children from spiritual instruction
Keep spiritual teachings private and avoid public reading
Allow children to decide if they want to learn the law
questions.correctAnswer: Gather all people, including children and strangers, to hear and learn the law
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:11-13 instructs gathering men, women, children, and strangers to hear the law so that everyone including the children may learn and fear the LORD.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with temptation to turn from God. According to Deuteronomy 31, what biblical truth warns about this danger?
options: After Moses’ death, the people will turn to other gods and break God’s covenant
God will ignore disobedience and allow anything
Temptation is not a real concern for believers
God expects people to worship many gods
questions.correctAnswer: After Moses’ death, the people will turn to other gods and break God’s covenant
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:16-18 predicts that the people will forsake God and worship other gods, breaking the covenant, highlighting the danger of turning from God.

questions.question: How does this chapter encourage believers to rely on God’s covenant and His Word in daily life?
options: By writing and placing the law beside the ark as a witness against rebellion
By disregarding the law and focusing on personal opinions
By hiding God’s Word from the people to avoid responsibility
By trusting only human traditions without Scripture
questions.correctAnswer: By writing and placing the law beside the ark as a witness against rebellion
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:24-26 describes Moses writing the law and placing it beside the ark as a witness, emphasizing the importance of Scripture in guiding faithfulness and obedience.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is emphasized through Moses’ repeated encouragement to Joshua in Deuteronomy 31?
questions.correctAnswer: Courage and faithfulness in leadership
questions.explanation: Moses repeatedly tells Joshua to be strong and courageous (Deuteronomy 31:7, 31:23), highlighting the virtue of steadfast faith and leadership.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 31 instruct the people to maintain reverence and obedience to God’s law over time?
options: By reading the law publicly every seven years during the Feast of Tabernacles
By only reading the law once and then forgetting it
By hiding the law from the people to prevent questions
By relying on oral stories without Scripture
questions.correctAnswer: By reading the law publicly every seven years during the Feast of Tabernacles
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:10-11 commands reading the law before all Israel every seven years at the year of release during the Feast of Tabernacles to foster obedience and reverence.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 31 teaches that God will abandon His people completely when they sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: While Deuteronomy 31:17-18 states God will hide His face when people sin, the overall message includes God’s presence and promises, encouraging repentance and trust, not complete abandonment.

questions.question: True or False: Moses wrote a song as a witness against Israel to remind them of their covenant responsibilities.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:19-22 records Moses writing a song to serve as a witness against Israel, teaching faithfulness and warning against turning from God.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 31 address the challenge of faithfulness in family and community life?
options: By teaching the law to children and ensuring all generations learn to fear the LORD
By focusing only on individual faith without community involvement
By neglecting the spiritual education of children
By allowing each family to interpret God’s law as they wish
questions.correctAnswer: By teaching the law to children and ensuring all generations learn to fear the LORD
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 emphasize gathering all people including children to hear the law so they learn to fear God and obey throughout generations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with integrity at work. Based on Deuteronomy 31, what principle can help them remain honest?
options: God’s law is a constant witness and guide, calling for obedience and integrity
It's acceptable to compromise integrity for success
Work ethic is unrelated to faith
Avoid accountability by hiding your actions
questions.correctAnswer: God’s law is a constant witness and guide, calling for obedience and integrity
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:26 highlights the law as a witness against rebellion, teaching believers to live with honesty and integrity in all areas including work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Moses was __ years old when he spoke these words and could no longer lead the people across the Jordan.
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:2 states Moses was 120 years old and could no longer go out or come in or lead across the Jordan.

questions.question: What instruction does Deuteronomy 31 give about sharing God’s law with everyone in the community?
options: Gather men, women, children, and strangers so all may hear and learn
Only teach the priests and elders
Exclude strangers and children from learning
Keep the law secret to avoid confusion
questions.correctAnswer: Gather men, women, children, and strangers so all may hear and learn
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:12 directs gathering all people, including strangers and children, to hear the law, emphasizing inclusiveness in spiritual education.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 31, what is the consequence of rebellion and forsaking God after Moses’ death?
options: God’s anger will be kindled, He will hide His face, and evils will befall the people
God will immediately bless them without consequences
Rebellion has no effect on God’s relationship with the people
God will physically punish only the leaders
questions.correctAnswer: God’s anger will be kindled, He will hide His face, and evils will befall the people
questions.explanation: Verses 16-18 and 27-29 warn that rebellion leads to God’s anger, hiding His face, and many troubles, teaching the importance of obedience and faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 31 guide believers in trusting God’s promises about their future inheritance?
options: Trust that the LORD will go before them and destroy nations to give them the land
Doubt God’s promises and rely on their own plans
Assume they will fail without God’s help
Ignore the promise and focus only on the present
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that the LORD will go before them and destroy nations to give them the land
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:3-5 encourages trust in God’s promise to go before Israel, destroy their enemies, and give them the land as an inheritance.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 31.

questions.question: What is the significance of Moses' age mentioned in Deuteronomy 31:2 in relation to his leadership transition?
options: Moses was too old to lead and was passing leadership to Joshua
Moses was still physically able to lead but chose to retire
Moses was planning to enter the Promised Land
questions.correctAnswer: Moses was too old to lead and was passing leadership to Joshua
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 31:2 states Moses is 120 years old and can no longer lead, indicating a leadership transition to Joshua.

questions.question: Which phrase in Deuteronomy 31:6 emphasizes God's faithfulness as a source of courage for Israel?
options: "he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee"
"Be strong and of a good courage"
"fear not, nor be afraid of them"
"the LORD thy God, he it is that doth go with thee"
questions.correctAnswer: "he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee"
questions.explanation: The phrase highlights God's unwavering presence and support as the foundation for courage (Deuteronomy 31:6).

questions.question: How does the command in Deuteronomy 31:10-13 to read the law every seven years function within Israelite society?
options: To educate all generations and foreigners about the covenant and obedience
To establish a new law code every seven years
To mark the beginning of a new king's reign
questions.correctAnswer: To educate all generations and foreigners about the covenant and obedience
questions.explanation: Verses 31:10-13 direct Israel to publicly read the law to all people, including children and foreigners, to maintain covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: What literary device is present in the repeated exhortation to Joshua to be 'strong and of a good courage' in Deuteronomy 31:7, 31:8, and 31:23?
questions.correctAnswer: Repetition for emphasis
questions.explanation: The repeated phrase underscores the importance of Joshua's courage and leadership during the transition (31:7, 31:8, 31:23).

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 31:9, to whom did Moses deliver the written law, and what is the significance of this group?
options: The priests, sons of Levi, guardians of the covenant
The kings of the surrounding nations
questions.correctAnswer: The priests, sons of Levi, guardians of the covenant
questions.explanation: Moses gave the law to the Levitical priests who bore the ark, symbolizing their role as custodians of God's covenant (31:9).

questions.question: What is the theological implication of the LORD appearing in a pillar of cloud at the tabernacle in Deuteronomy 31:15?
options: God’s continued presence and guidance with Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God’s continued presence and guidance with Israel
questions.explanation: The pillar of cloud is a theophany indicating God's presence and leadership, echoing Exodus narratives (31:15).

questions.question: What future event does God foretell in Deuteronomy 31:16-18 regarding Israel’s relationship with Him?
options: Israel will forsake God and worship foreign gods
Israel will conquer all their enemies without fail
Israel will build a permanent temple before entering the land
questions.correctAnswer: Israel will forsake God and worship foreign gods
questions.explanation: God predicts Israel’s apostasy and covenant breaking after Moses’ death (31:16-18).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the song mentioned in Deuteronomy 31:19-22?
options: To serve as a witness and reminder of Israel’s covenant with God
To celebrate the conquest of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: To serve as a witness and reminder of Israel’s covenant with God
questions.explanation: The song is meant to testify against Israel if they break the covenant, functioning as a legal and theological witness (31:19-22).

questions.question: What instruction does Moses give concerning the book of the law in Deuteronomy 31:26, and why is this significant?
options: Place it beside the ark as a witness against Israel
Send it to the kings of other nations
questions.correctAnswer: Place it beside the ark as a witness against Israel
questions.explanation: Placing the law beside the ark symbolizes its authority and serves as a constant covenant reminder (31:26).

questions.question: What does Moses’ declaration of Israel’s 'rebellion' and 'stiff neck' in Deuteronomy 31:27 reveal about Israel’s character and future challenges?
options: Israel is prone to disobedience, which will worsen after Moses’ death
Israel is completely obedient and faithful
Israel will immediately enter the Promised Land without opposition
Israel is united and without conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Israel is prone to disobedience, which will worsen after Moses’ death
questions.explanation: Verse 31:27 acknowledges Israel's rebellious nature and foreshadows greater disobedience post-Moses.

questions.question: Which ancient Near Eastern cultural practice is reflected in Moses’ call to 'call heaven and earth to record' in Deuteronomy 31:28?
options: Using cosmic witnesses in covenant treaties
questions.correctAnswer: Using cosmic witnesses in covenant treaties
questions.explanation: Invoking heaven and earth as witnesses parallels treaty language common in ANE cultures (31:28).

questions.question: How does the motif of covenant renewal in Deuteronomy 31 relate to similar themes in Joshua and Judges?
options: It foreshadows Israel’s cyclical faithfulness and apostasy described in Judges
It predicts Israel’s constant success without failure
It denies the possibility of covenant breaking
It focuses solely on Moses without mention of Joshua
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows Israel’s cyclical faithfulness and apostasy described in Judges
questions.explanation: The covenant warnings and renewal in Deuteronomy 31 anticipate the cycles of obedience and rebellion in Judges.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 31:23 indicates that God’s presence will be with Joshua as he leads Israel into the Promised Land.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 31:23 states God will be with Joshua, affirming divine support for his leadership.

questions.question: What is the significance of Moses speaking the song 'in the ears of all the congregation' in Deuteronomy 31:30?
options: Public proclamation to ensure communal memory and accountability
A private message only to priests
questions.correctAnswer: Public proclamation to ensure communal memory and accountability
questions.explanation: Moses publicly recites the song to embed the covenant witness in the entire community (31:30).

questions.question: How does the concept of 'fear' in Deuteronomy 31:12-13 function within the covenant relationship?
options: As reverence and obedience toward God
As a superstition unrelated to faith
questions.correctAnswer: As reverence and obedience toward God
questions.explanation: The 'fear of the LORD' commands respect and covenant loyalty, foundational in Israelite religion (31:12-13).

questions.question: What is the role of Joshua as outlined in Deuteronomy 31:3, and how does it relate to the theme of divine promise?
options: Joshua will lead the people across the Jordan to inherit the land promised by God
Joshua will replace Moses as a priest
Joshua will build the first temple
questions.correctAnswer: Joshua will lead the people across the Jordan to inherit the land promised by God
questions.explanation: Verse 31:3 emphasizes Joshua’s role in fulfilling God’s promise to Israel by leading them into the land.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 31 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What reason does Moses give for not being able to enter the promised land?
options: He is too old and the LORD has forbidden him
questions.correctAnswer: He is too old and the LORD has forbidden him
questions.explanation: Moses states he is 120 years old and cannot go in because the LORD said he shall not cross the Jordan (Deuteronomy 31:2). This highlights God's sovereign decree and Moses' role as servant, consistent with Numbers 20:12 and Psalm 90:10.

questions.question: Who is appointed to lead Israel into the promised land after Moses?
questions.correctAnswer: Joshua
questions.explanation: Joshua is divinely appointed to lead Israel into Canaan (Deuteronomy 31:3,7,23), pointing to God’s faithfulness in fulfilling promises, and prefiguring Christ as the ultimate leader (Hebrews 4:8-10).

questions.question: What command does Moses give Joshua in front of all Israel?
options: Be strong and of good courage
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and of good courage
questions.explanation: Moses exhorts Joshua to be courageous as he leads Israel (Deuteronomy 31:7), emphasizing reliance on God’s presence, a theme echoed in Joshua 1:6-9 and 2 Timothy 1:7.

questions.question: Who is commanded to read the law publicly every seven years during the feast of tabernacles?
questions.correctAnswer: The priests and elders
questions.explanation: Moses commands the priests (sons of Levi) and elders to read the law publicly at the year of release (Deuteronomy 31:9-11), underscoring the responsibility of religious leaders to teach the law, consistent with Nehemiah 8 and Ezra 7.

questions.question: What is the purpose of gathering all Israel, including strangers, to hear the law?
options: So all may learn and fear the LORD and obey His commandments
questions.correctAnswer: So all may learn and fear the LORD and obey His commandments
questions.explanation: The law is read so everyone hears, learns to fear God, and obeys (Deuteronomy 31:12), reflecting the covenantal call to holiness as in Leviticus 19:2 and Joshua 24:14-15.

questions.question: What warning does God give Moses concerning the future faithfulness of Israel after his death?
options: They will turn to foreign gods and break the covenant
They will conquer all enemies without fail
questions.correctAnswer: They will turn to foreign gods and break the covenant
questions.explanation: God reveals Israel will forsake Him and worship other gods after Moses dies (Deuteronomy 31:16-18), an expression of human sinfulness and covenantal failure consistent with Judges 2:11-19 and Jeremiah 2:11-13.

questions.question: What will be the consequence when Israel turns away from God as predicted in this chapter?
options: God’s anger, hiding His face, and evils will befall them
They will be forgiven without repentance
questions.correctAnswer: God’s anger, hiding His face, and evils will befall them
questions.explanation: The LORD warns of His anger, hiding His face, and calamities upon Israel’s apostasy (Deuteronomy 31:17-18), showing divine holiness and justice consistent with Psalm 44:24-26 and Isaiah 59:1-2.

questions.question: What did Moses write and teach to the children of Israel as a witness against them?
questions.correctAnswer: A song
questions.explanation: Moses wrote a song as a witness against Israel’s future rebellion (Deuteronomy 31:19,22,30), illustrating prophetic accountability and covenant reminder, similar to Psalm 78 and Revelation 15:3.

questions.question: Why was the song to be remembered and passed down according to this chapter?
options: To testify against Israel’s future disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: To testify against Israel’s future disobedience
questions.explanation: The song serves as a testimony against Israel when they sin, to not be forgotten by their descendants (Deuteronomy 31:21), showing God’s patience and justice, echoed in Jeremiah 31:33 and Hebrews 8:10.

questions.question: What did Moses command be done with the book of the law after writing it?
options: Placed beside the ark of the covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Placed beside the ark of the covenant
questions.explanation: Moses instructed that the law be put beside the ark as a witness (Deuteronomy 31:26), symbolizing God’s covenant presence and authority, consistent with Exodus 25:21-22 and Hebrews 9:4.

questions.question: What characteristic of Israel does Moses acknowledge in this chapter concerning their obedience?
options: They have a rebellious and stiff neck
questions.correctAnswer: They have a rebellious and stiff neck
questions.explanation: Moses recognizes Israel’s rebellion and stubbornness (Deuteronomy 31:27), reflecting the human condition of sinfulness and need for grace, as seen in Exodus 32:9 and Romans 3:23.

questions.question: What does God call to record against Israel when Moses speaks to the elders?
questions.correctAnswer: Heaven and earth
questions.explanation: Moses calls heaven and earth to witness the covenant and Israel’s obedience (Deuteronomy 31:28), a common biblical motif emphasizing divine accountability, also found in Deuteronomy 30:19 and Isaiah 1:2.

questions.question: What encouragement is repeatedly given to Joshua regarding leading Israel?
options: Be strong and of good courage
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and of good courage
questions.explanation: Joshua is repeatedly encouraged to be courageous (Deuteronomy 31:6,7,8,23), underscoring divine presence and strength, paralleling Christ’s call to boldness (John 16:33) and the Spirit’s empowerment (Acts 1:8).

questions.question: What does this chapter reveal about God's presence with His people?
options: God will not fail or forsake them
God will be distant and silent
God will leave them to their own devices
questions.correctAnswer: God will not fail or forsake them
questions.explanation: God’s faithfulness is emphasized: He will not fail or forsake Israel (Deuteronomy 31:6,8,23), revealing His covenantal steadfastness, consistent with Hebrews 13:5 and Isaiah 41:10.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the LORD appearing as a pillar of cloud in this chapter?
options: It signifies God’s guidance and presence among His people
It is a sign of judgment only
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies God’s guidance and presence among His people
questions.explanation: The pillar of cloud over the tabernacle signifies God’s presence and guidance (Deuteronomy 31:15), consistent with Exodus 13:21-22 and Psalm 99:7, illustrating God’s covenantal leadership.

questions.question: What is the ultimate purpose of the law and the song that Moses wrote according to this chapter?
options: To teach, warn, and hold Israel accountable to God’s covenant
questions.correctAnswer: To teach, warn, and hold Israel accountable to God’s covenant
questions.explanation: The law and song serve to instruct and warn Israel, acting as covenant witnesses (Deuteronomy 31:19-21,26,30), illustrating God’s justice and mercy, paralleling prophetic warnings in Jeremiah 31:33 and Ezekiel 36:26-27.
